message: Was just sworn in as a member of the 115th Congress. It is the honor of my life to serve the people of the 9th District.

Today was the first day of the 115th Congress. Two months ago the voice of the American people was heard, and as I have been since my first day in office – I continue be honored to represent the people of Pennsylvania’s 9th Congressional District. The American people made it clear that they wanted a Congress and White House that will work together to advance ideas that will strengthen our economy and restore our powerful standing around the world. Today is just the beginning of what is going to be an important step forward for this nation.   As Chairman of the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, I’m ready to work with President-elect Donald Trump to rebuild America’s infrastructure. We are going to invest in our roads and bridges, modernize our outdated aviation system, and continue improving our waterways. President-elect Trump is also ready to work with us on destroying ISIS, and I appreciate the opportunity to serve on a committee that will be tasked with ensuring our military has the tools needed to do so.   We are going to be a stronger nation after the 115th Congress passes common sense policies that will not be blocked by President Obama, but signed into law by our Republican Administration.   This is an exciting day, and it is time to get to work.
It’s time to come together to advance ideas that will strengthen our economy and restore our powerful standing around the world. Let’s get to work!
Trooper Landon Weaver will always be remembered.

While the Obama Administration may have seen regulations as just words on a page,  in my district they drastically impact people’s lives. That is why I was so pleased to see the House pass the REINS Act last night, a bill I cosponsored that will bring sanity back to regulations by having major rules reviewed by Congress so they don’t continue to destroy our economy.
Earlier today a joint session of the House and Senate officially certified Donald Trump as our next president and Mike Pence as our next vice president. Congratulations to both – let’s get to work!
The situation in Florida is tragic. Prayers for both the victims and law enforcement.

Our region has been a leader in autonomous vehicle technology, and as Chairman of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, I’ve had the chance to ride in some of these innovative vehicles several times.  It's remarkable how far this technology has come, and if it is developed and implemented properly, it has the potential to save lives and change the way we get around.
Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, and I hope everyone in DC can see my window because it’s proudly lit up for the men and women in blue.

Suppressors are protecting the hearing of sportsmen every day, and there shouldn't be an unnecessary government fee just to purchase one.  I was glad to cosponsor H.R.367 earlier today – this legislation will remove the transfer tax on purchasing a suppressor. Thank you Altoona Mayor Matt Pacifico for working with me to bring attention to this issue!
Just cast my vote in the Armed Services Committee for James Mattis as Secretary of Defense. Could not think of a more qualified pick to lead our armed forces and protect America.

Obamacare is broken, and it has failed my constituents. Premiums have increased, people have lost their doctor, and quality healthcare plans have been eliminated. The House’s action will allow Congress to begin the process of repealing Obamacare and replacing it with healthcare reforms that will be good for all Americans.
"The time is always right to do what is right." - Martin Luther King Jr.
Manning put the lives of our service members at risk and compromised national security by leaking classified information. It is an outrage that this sentence was commuted.

I look forward to attending the inauguration tomorrow.  I was there to see Clinton hand over power to Bush, and then to see Bush hand it over to Obama.    The president peacefully passing over power to the other party on Inauguration Day is a moment for our nation that should never be taken for granted and is something we should be proud of.
Donald Trump is about to be sworn in as the next President of the United States. Watch live.

Witnessing the peaceful passing of power from one party to another is a moment that we should never take for granted and is something that we should be proud of as Americans.  Donald Trump is going to be a great president. He’s going to listen to the American people – and work with Congress to fix Washington and put this nation on the right track. Republicans have a great opportunity to put forth the policies that have been missing over the last eight years - the policies that will improve the lives of people in Central and Southwestern Pennsylvania.  Let’s get to work.
Getting to work on day one: with his executive order, President Trump has officially joined the House’s fight to repeal and replace Obamacare and bring quality coverage to the American people.

In the 9th District, we know the importance of energy, but that didn’t stop the Obama Administration from trying to do everything it could to stop Keystone XL along with other projects across the country. I have been a leader in the fight to approve Keystone XL, introducing a bill to help approve the project, and I applaud President Trump for his executive order to help us move this forward.
Life is a precious gift and we must always protect it. Proud to vote tonight to make the Hyde amendment permanent, blocking taxpayer money from funding abortions.

Congratulations to Pittsburgh International Airport for being named Airport of the Year by Air Transport World!    I’ve seen firsthand many of the improvements made at the airport over the last few years, and I’m glad that our region has close access to one of the best airports in the country.

We promised a controlled border and we are going to deliver. Our security is more important than ever and I am looking forward to continuing to work with the Trump Administration to keep America safe.
Infrastructure is going to be a top priority for this new Congress and the Trump Administration and we are ready to start rebuilding America!

This week the house passed a major pro-life bill I cosponsored, the  No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act, we have a pro-life president and VP, and the largest pro-life rally in the world is taking place. I am proud to be a leader in the pro-life fight, and am looking forward to all the great success that await us protecting the unborn.

The safety and security of the American people is my top priority, and it is clear that ISIS will stop at nothing in order to find a path to American soil. I support President Trump’s efforts to temporary halt non-United States citizens from these seven countries for 120 days while the Department of Homeland Security reviews ways to better protect and strengthen a flawed vetting process. We cannot afford to get this wrong, not even once out of thousands of applications. We need to put politics aside and remember that this is an issue of national security, and will ensure we strengthen our vetting procedures so that everything that can be done is done to protect this nation from radical Islamic terrorists.

President Trump’s decision to nominate Judge Neil Gorsuch to the Supreme Court is a great choice for the American people, and is exactly why the people of Pennsylvania supported him for president.  President Trump has selected an immensely qualified individual who will preserve the Constitution. As a Supreme Court Justice, Judge Neil Gorsuch will have the solemn duty to interpret and apply our laws in some of the most important cases in the nation.  I urge my colleagues in the Senate to act swiftly to confirm Judge Neil Gorsuch, and look forward to his service on the United States Supreme Court.
There’s been a lot of high praise for Judge Neil Gorsuch today from people that know him well. It was a great selection by President Trump and I hope the Senate acts swiftly to confirm him.
As Chairman of the Transportation & Infrastructure Committee, let me just say, “Don’t drive angry!” #groundhogday

I am glad the House took action to stop this discriminatory midnight rule from the Obama administration which infringes on the 2nd amendment rights of Social Security beneficiaries.  The government should not take away your due process and gun rights.
Looking good, 41! Glad to see President George HW and Barbara Bush feeling better and on the mend!

Today I heard from the four service vice chiefs of the armed forces on the status of the military, and what I heard was troubling. After years of cuts from the Obama Administration we have a readiness crisis, but now that is going to change. Working with this new administration, I am committed to giving our men and women in uniform all the tools and support they need to keep America safe.   Watch the hearing here → https://armedservices.house.gov/legislation/hearings/full-committee-hearing-state-military
I am a passionate believer in infrastructure, because it benefits everyone. This is why we need to invest in Pennsylvania and rebuild America!

Fantastic visit to Boeing in Smithfield where I was honored to invite the CEO of the Boeing’s Defense, Space & Security division to join us to speak about the future of the facility. Very happy to hear the facility will remain central to Boeing’s business going forward.

I’m glad that these police officers will have access to naloxone, a tool that can save lives of the people fighting this terrible addiction. I am confident we will continue to work together as a community to bring an end to this epidemic.

The head of one of the nation’s largest health insurers has said what we have known for years: Obamacare is in a death spiral. This is why we can not lose focus on what matters the most, which is providing quality health coverage for the American people without big-government interference.

Last night the House took action to reverse an Obama Administration rule that made it difficult for states to implement policies that allow for drug testing applicants for unemployment insurance.   This legislative action will allow states to save hundreds of thousands of dollars by ensuring that drug abusers are not receiving the unemployment insurance meant for hard working people looking for employment.

I met with President Donald J. Trump at the White House on Thursday to discuss some of the work we will be doing together, including rebuilding our roads and bridges by investing in our infrastructure. We are already advancing policies that are good for American jobs and that’s going to continue under a Republican Congress and the Trump Administration.

The Altoona VA had five interim directors and remains without permanent leadership. Why are over 20 medical centers across the country not being permanently staffed with directors? There are hardworking people serving our veterans at the VA, but a lack of management is deeply concerning, which is why I have worked with Rep. Mike Bost to introduce legislation to require the VA to produce a plan to hire highly qualified directors within 120 days. The situation is not acceptable and our veterans deserve better.
General H.R. McMaster is an excellent choice by Trump for National Security Advisor. An experienced leader, I am confident he will bring fresh solutions to many of the security problems we face.

Obamacare was rushed through Congress on promises that have not delivered. I have heard from my constituents about the issues they face with premiums, cost of medication and access to doctors, and Obamacare has only made it worse. That is why we are replacing this law with something better: real reform, not another increase in the size of government. We're going to keep listening to you, and we're going to do it right. Read my full op-ed with Congressman Keith Rothfus and Representative Mike Kelly.

In case you missed it, I have helped introduce a bill to address the leadership vacancies at VA Medical Centers – including the continued lack of permanent leadership at the Altoona VA. Make no mistake, many qualified and hardworking people work at the VA, but this lack of long-term leadership is a disservice to the veterans who rely on this care.

Here’s a good story about 73 year old Ed Hughes, a Pennsylvania native. He is an avid sportsman and when’s he’s shooting his guns he relies on hearing protection equipment like a suppressor.  I’m glad to support legislation that protects the hearing of our sportsmen and removes a costly government fee in place just to purchase safety equipment.

I was at the White House today with President Trump as he signed an executive order starting a formal review of the WOTUS rule. I have been working to stop this big-government power grab from day one, and after leading the fight in Congress, it’s great to see the president join us in highlighting the major concerns with this poorly drafted rule.

President Trump was elected by huge margins in Central and Southwestern Pennsylvania because he promised to shake up Washington, and that’s exactly what he has been doing. Tonight he delivered the strong speech that has been missing over the last eight years. He reaffirmed his commitment to ensuring that our government is doing everything that it can to protect the American people from threats foreign and domestic. He continued to echo my strong belief in the need to make major investments in our infrastructure. He outlined the work we are doing together to eliminate the regulations that have hurt our small businesses and farmers.  President Trump did not just speak to one group or political party, he spoke to all Americans. He addressed the issues impacting people of all backgrounds – from sky rocketing health insurance premiums hurting families in rural areas to rising crime rates in our cities, this is a president that is going to listen to the people and act. We have challenges ahead, but I’m confident that President Trump and our Republican Congress are going to move forward with a bold agenda that will benefit all Americans.

President Trump delivered a strong speech last night, but I was particularly drawn to what he said about the opioid crisis. This problem has touched our district in tragic ways, and I am glad the president will join me in working to address this issue.

Wonderful to meet with my good friend Carolyn Donaldson to discuss WPSU and issues related to public broadcasting. She did a tremendous job at WTAJ-TV and I know she'll keep up the great work with WPSU!

This is a group of extremely hard working people, and I am always happy to meet with them every chance I get.   Today these farm bureau representatives from the 9th district discussed the positive changes they will see by eliminating some harmful government regulations along with their other legislative priorities for the year.
Just spent some time at UPMC Altoona, meeting with some of the hospital leadership. We discussed the healthcare landscape and some of the great work they continue to do for our community.

Recently some members of the Pennsylvania Civil Air Patrol from my district swung by my office in Washington to provide an update on their youth development and work assisting first responders. Thanks for stoping by!

Technical and Career training is crucial for us to remain competitive and opens all sorts of doors for those who pursue it. It was excellent to hear more about this from the folks at YTI Career Institute - Altoona!
Congrats to MG Kurt S. Crytzer, Indiana University of Pennsylvania '86, on his promotion to Major General last week and for representing @iup and PA-09 in service to the nation!
Proud to help pass a defense appropriations bill tonight that will bring badly-needed money to the nation’s military. A solid first step toward rebuilding our armed forces!

It was an honor having Chris Fidler and Bill Lightner, two heroes from the 9th District who served their country stop by the office with Paralyzed Veterans of America to discuss how we can better help those who wore the uniform.
Folks, we have some winter weather headed our way, so be sure to stay safe and avoid driving unless absolutely necessary! Here are a few tips you can use to prepare.
I think I speak for everyone in the 9th district when I say thank you to the great work all of our plow truck drivers do keeping the roads clear.
The tradition of the White House Easter Egg Roll dates back to 1878. If you would like to sign your family up for the lottery to receive tickets please click below!

Fantastic news – the bill I co-introduced with Rep. Mike Bost to require the VA to explain why so many leadership positions at medical centers remain vacant or staffed with temporary employees. Everyone knows leadership starts at the top and we need permanent leadership to ensure care for  our veterans!   This was part of an entire package of legislation that will help reform the VA, part of our larger effort to change the way of doing business top to bottom and bring better treatment for those who served.

Tune in here to watch Judge Neil Gorsuch’s confirmation hearing. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to act swiftly to confirm Judge Neil Gorsuch, and look forward to his service on the United States Supreme Court.

I appreciate all of the calls I have been getting from coal miners and their families about H.R.179, the Miners Protection Act of 2017. I’m a supporter of this legislation, and I will continue to speak to my colleagues about how important it is that we protect these hardworking miners’ pensions and healthcare.

The Keystone project, without spending a single taxpayer dollar, will put people to work, strengthen our energy independence, and help build a 21st century infrastructure for America.    This has been the most thoroughly vetted pipeline project in our history, and we commend the Trump administration for listening to the American people and making the right decision for our country.  We look forward to this long-delayed project finally moving toward reality.

I’m glad that President Trump invited some miners from Indiana County to the signing of an Executive Order earlier today to call for a review of the job-killing Clean Power Plan. This is an important step in rolling back some of the burdensome regulations crafted by the Obama Administration to impact the coal industry.   I was a fierce opponent of the Obama Administration’s Clean Power Plan because of the destruction it would bring to our region’s coal industry. President Trump’s Executive Order upholds the commitment he made to reverse the radical policies that were harming the middle class, domestic energy production, and the economy.
ICYMI: With Indiana County coal miners on his side Tuesday afternoon, President Trump signed an Executive Order that is going to benefit our region’s coal miners.

North Korea has committed itself to a dangerous path, and by ignoring the international community, brutally suppressing human rights and building a nuclear weapons program it threatens all of our security. That is why I was pleased to see the House pass legislation I cosponsored condemning this reckless nuclear weapons program, and highlighting that America stands against this criminal regime.
There must be consequences for Assad’s terrible attack on innocent men, women, and children. I support the president’s actions against the Assad regime.
Watch live here as Neil Gorsuch is sworn in as our nation’s next Supreme Court associate justice:
Today is #NationalPetDay, and we had our own visitor stop by the Shuster office in honor of the occasion. How are you celebrating?

Patriot missiles made at Letterkenny Army Depot save lives, but the Army is at risk of dropping below the minimum number needed to continue protecting our troops. That is why I am pleased to announce I have introduced the Patriot Inventory Protection Act to ensure that our men and women in uniform remain well-defended, and would have the potential to bring added work to Letterkenny for years to come.   Read more here → https://shuster.house.gov/press-releases/shuster-introduces-legislation-to-bring-added-work-to-letterkenny/
From my family to yours, happy Easter Sunday to all celebrating this beautiful, blessed day.  He is risen!
Glad to have the support of Fayette County commissioners on the Miners Protection Act. I will continue to encourage my colleagues in Congress to support this legislation. Read more here:

We cannot risk leaving our troops in the Middle East unprotected.  I’ve introduced a bill that will avert a potential missile defense crisis within the Army, has the potential to save American taxpayers millions of dollars, and would bring new work to Letterkenny.
Great news!  Bedford and Cambria County ambulance stations receive Department of Homeland Security Assistance to Firefighter Grants
On Holocaust Remembrance Day we remember the 6 million Jewish victims, including the 1.5 million children who perished in the Holocaust.
The opioid epidemic has hit Pennsylvanians especially hard. Thank you, President Trump and Secretary Price, for working with Congress and making it a top priority to end this crisis.
NA
NA
Congress and the White House are responding to the message heard loud and clear last fall from the American people. My thoughts on the president's first 100 days in office:
Congratulations to Rostraver Ice Garden in Belle Vernon on the new title-- 2017 Hockeyville, USA!  Rostraver Ice Garden - Kraft Hockeyville USA 2017
Did you know? There are 29 million small businesses in the United States, including 1 million in Pennsylvania.  What’s your favorite local small business?
You can watch today's hearing on airline customer service issues here:
I was very direct with the airline industry today—the flying public deserves better service.
This is a massive win for thousands of coal miners and their families in western Pennsylvania, and I thank President Trump for following through on his promise that he would support coal communities.

The American Health Care Act will put patients back in charge of their health plans, instead of Washington. I was proud to be at the White House with President Trump after keeping our promise to Pennsylvanians that we would work to repeal and replace Obamacare before it collapses.

Flashback Friday—to when I signed up for Obamacare. While I did not support the law, I think we can all agree that bills passed by Congress should apply to Congress and their staff. I was a cosponsor on the “No Obamacare Subsidies for Congress Act” in 2013, and I also voted for H.R. 2192 yesterday which guarantees that the American Health Care Act will apply to all of us. Regardless of your opinion on the AHCA, I want you to know I WILL be subject to the bill, as will my staff.
These training programs will result in improved safety and more efficient operations, all in the name of providing better service to the residents of Altoona.
Thinking of my mother a lot today, happy Mother's Day and thank you to all of the mothers out there for everything you do.
This week we express our gratitude to those who put their lives on the line to keep communities safe. Thank you to our law enforcement!
Today is primary day in Pennsylvania, make sure to get out and exercise your civic duty! Polls are open until 8:00 p.m., and you can find help here if you need to locate your polling place:

In order to remain competitive, we need a 21st century infrastructure with modern, 21st century technology. Watch live below as the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee examines the need to reform the FAA and Air Traffic Control to build a 21st Century aviation system for America:

Law enforcement officers and their families risk everything to keep America a safe nation of law and order. I will proudly be voting in favor of the Thin Blue Line Act this afternoon, which will make clear that the United States does not tolerate cowards who target and attack our police.

Attention Social Security recipients! Effective June 10th, “My Social Security” users will be required to use a cell phone number or personal email as a second layer of security when you log in. Here’s everything you need to know to update your account:

My heart breaks for the victims in Manchester and their families. Last night’s disgusting attack shows that we face enemies who do not hesitate to kill innocent people, even stooping as low to harm children and teenagers enjoying a concert. The United States stands with the UK and the rest of the world committed to conquering this terrorism.

If you are a veteran of the United States military, you deserve timely access to care, to have both your physical and invisible wounds of war treated, and should not have to wait by the telephone for months waiting on a disability benefits decision.   I was proud to vote this week in favor of these seven bills designed to improve quality of care for our veterans.

Today on Memorial Day, we remember that our freedom isn't free.  For some of us, today is an annual reminder of the brave men and women who gave their lives defending our country. Many others are reminded every day of the family members and friends who are no longer with us, whose absence is physically felt.  Scripture teaches us there is no greater love than this, that one would lay down their life for their loved ones. We are blessed to live in a country where our freedom is so cherished and loved that brave men and women will give the last full measure of devotion to preserve it for future generations. The burden is now ours, we must ensure their patriotism and love for our freedom continue so their sacrifices are not in vain.
June is Alzheimer’s and brain awareness month. It’s important to learn more about this devastating disease so we can end the stigma and #ENDALZ

Thank you for having me on Russ, it was a pleasure to come on the show and discuss how I’m working with the president to rein in the size and scope of the federal government to make it work for the American people again.
We stand with our allies in the U.K. in total support. This Islamic extremism cannot be tolerated by any nation.

At 11:30 a.m. I will be joining President Trump at the White House to discuss the need to reform and modernize the FAA and our nation’s outdated air traffic control system. Join us by watching live below.

It is time to bring our country’s infrastructure into the 21st century. Unfortunately the U.S. is falling behind in an industry we invented, aviation. At a time where more people are flying than ever before, the United States has an obligation to ensure our technology can keep up—and that means the millions of people who fly every day should have their flights tracked by satellite and GPS, not by paper slips and WWII-era technology.  I thank President Trump for introducing his principles on bold air traffic control reform, and will continue to work with the administration to deliver the most efficient and safe airspace we possibly can.   President Trump said it best today: “It’s about time.”  https://transportation.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=401506

73 years ago today the brave men in the United States military stormed the beaches of Normandy, many of whom would never return. It’s hard to imagine what our country or freedoms would look today without their tremendous courage and sacrifice.

Yesterday President Trump signed his bold principles for air traffic control reform, but also took time to sign a 100th birthday card for one of my constituents! It was very sweet and will certainly make her birthday even more special.

Tomorrow Secretary Chao will be testifying at the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee to help educate the public and answer questions on FAA and air traffic control reform. To learn more about the administration’s approach to modernize our skies, visit the Department of Transportation’s new website: www.SmarterSkies.gov.

This program is very special as it does not offer a hand out, but a hand up, making sure families have equity in it. When you turn home ownership over to people, they take great pride in not only their homes, but their neighborhoods as well.

President Donald J. Trump and I are working very closely together to bring our nation’s infrastructure into the 21st century. Thank you for the kind words Mr. President, but more importantly thank you for making it a top priority to rebuild our country!
Amazing game last night—congratulations to the Pittsburgh Penguins for winning back-to-back Stanley Cup championships!

We are ending the war on coal and coal communities. Thanks to the president’s leadership, we will be using more Pennsylvania coal to make American steel. This new mine alone in Somerset County adds hundreds of well-paying jobs in the area for years to come.
Praying for my colleague Steve Scalise, Capitol Police, and all staff targeted this morning in this horrific shooting.
NA
Wishing a happy birthday to the men and women of the United States Army. There is no more capable, professional fighting force in the world - you look good for 242, Army!
Had a great meeting with talented students from my district participating in NRECA's 2017 Electric Cooperative Youth Tour. I have no doubt these bright minds will achieve incredible things!

Acosta’s new mine is an economic shot in the arm for Somerset County and western Pennsylvania. Four times as many people applied for these well-paying jobs than they were hiring. I’m looking forward to the next opening already!

The United States has not reformed its tax code since 1986, resulting in one of the most complicated and anti-business tax codes in the world. We are working in the House to simplify taxes so you have an easier time filing for tax day, and level the playing field so American businesses can compete globally, increase wages, and create jobs.
Take a look at the new PA drivers’ licenses and their new security features. All driver and photo centers are expected to be issuing the new licenses by the end of October.

For America to be the global leader in air transportation, we can’t be complacent – we have to be bold. That is why today I am introducing the bipartisan 21st Century AIRR Act, a landmark bill to create new passenger protections, modernize the antiquated system we use to control the skies, and encourage American innovation in new aerial technology.  You can learn more about my plan to give the American people a better flying experience here → https://transportation.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=401599

This is excellent for our nation’s veterans. Watch live as President Trump signs the Department of Veterans Affairs Accountability and Whistleblower Protection Act, a landmark bill helping our veterans that I proudly voted to pass.
A breath of fresh air for the brave first responders working to keep Indiana residents safe →
We need to place American innovation ahead of Washington bureaucracy. The bipartisan 21st Century AIRR Act puts taxpayers first to deliver modern, smarter skies.
Have you signed up for my newsletter? Check out the latest edition to see the services I proudly provide to constituents in the 9th District. Please, let me know if there’s anything I can do to help.

After 14 hours of debating over 300 amendments, last night we passed the National Defense Authorization Act out of committee. My legislation to keep the Patriot GEM-T missile in the Army inventory and bring more work to Letterkenny is INCLUDED in the bill, and my amendment explicitly prohibiting a round of Base Realignment and Closures (BRAC) passed, which means Letterkenny remains open and supporting the men and women of our military.

Today I proudly voted in favor of Kate’s Law and the No Sanctuary for Criminals Act to strengthen penalties for deported felons who attempt to return to the U.S. soil, and to hold law-breaking cities responsible for putting politics ahead of American lives. Federal immigration laws are not optional, and illegal immigration is not a victimless crime.

241 years ago America declared her independence and fought for a government of, by, and for the people. Today we are blessed with the freedoms and individual liberties built on the sacrifices of countless patriots who have fought to keep them alive. Happy Independence Day and may God Bless America.

The National Defense Authorization Act negotiated last week includes my legislation to prevent a missile-defense shortfall within the Army and potentially bring years of added work to Letterkenny Army Depot. →

Central High School student Brittany Albright’s watercolor painting “Lorraine Covered Bridge of Rails to Trails” will represent Pennsylvania’s 9th District in the 2017 Congressional High School Art Competition.   Last week I had the pleasure of welcoming the Albrights to my Washington office and showing them around the Capitol, including where her winning artwork will be displayed for the next year. Congratulations Brittany!

My Washington, D.C. office is now accepting applications for fall internships. Do you know a bright college student or recent graduate who would be interested in hands-on experience in a Congressional office? Encourage them to send a cover letter and resume to PA09jobs@gmail.com. Preference will be given to constituents of the 9th district and students with strong ties to Pennsylvania. More information can be found at https://shuster.house.gov/internships/.

This week the House will continue negotiating and vote on the National Defense Authorization Act. This legislation will protect America’s soldiers, sailors, airmen and marines, and as we get closer to a floor vote on the final bill, I will do everything I can to make sure Letterkenny remains protected.

This is absurd. They are asking the city to put policies on the books explicitly ignoring federal immigration laws and placing American citizens at risk.   Read more here about my recent actions to combat so-called ‘sanctuary' cities → https://shuster.house.gov/press-releases/stopping-sanctuary-cities-and-saving-american-lives2/

BREAKING: The House just passed the FY18 National Defense Authorization Act, the annual defense bill that I helped draft. What is in the #FY18NDAA? My prohibition on BRAC that will protect Letterkenny Army Depoy, legislation I introduced to keep the GEM-T missile in the Army and save taxpayer money, a pay raise for the troops, fixes for the readiness crisis, agile responses to new threats and more.
Congratulations to the men and women of Letterkenny Army Depot on 75 years of operational excellence supporting American war-fighters!

Today the House of Representatives was very blessed to have Reverend Terry Sanders of Victory House Ministry in Uniontown serve as guest chaplain and lead us in prayer. It was an honor to host Reverend Sanders and his wife Rhonda in D.C., two incredible people who live to serve God and are always working to better their community.

Reverend Sanders is the Founder, CEO, and Director of Genesis House Ministry in Uniontown where he makes a difference in the lives of men leaving the prison system and helps them transition back to society. He also serves as Chaplain of the Fayette County Prison and Pastor of Victory House Ministry in Uniontown. I’m grateful to have such a quality man be able to join us and lead the House in prayer today.

Pittsburgh International Airport is urging members of Congress to support my bill, the 21st Century AIRR Act, because it will lead to a modern, efficient aviation system for the American flying public:   “The good news is that we know this nonprofit system works. Canada, Australia and many other developed nations have already taken this step with success. This country helped to pioneer the commercial aviation system, but unfortunately we are being left behind with old technology and a system that is stressed and rife with delays,” said Pittsburgh International Airport CEO Christina Cassotis.

Important news - the House just voted to fund President Trump's budget request to construct a wall on our nation's southern border. This is a landmark step towards finally securing our border and curbing illegal immigration.

As it stands now, the opioid epidemic kills as many Americans lost in 9/11 every three weeks, and drug overdoses are now the leading cause of death for Americans under the age of 50.   Attorney General Sessions has my full support in investigating and prosecuting those who are lining their pockets and contributing to this national crisis.

It was a pleasure meeting with Major General Douglas Graham, commander of US Army Aviation and Missile Command. We discussed Letterkenny Army Depot, what's coming down the pike for future workload, and how we can continue to make sure the depot and its workforce are successful for years to come.

If you’ve worn the uniform and put your life on the line to defend the United States, you deserve the best quality of care possible. Check out my latest newsletter to see the work done during this Congress to reform the VA and provide better care for our veterans. You can sign up to receive my newsletter here: https://shuster.house.gov/email-updates-form
Last night six police officers were viciously attacked, including two Pennsylvania State Troopers shot in Fayette County. I'm praying for these officers, their families, and that our nation may heal.
Keeping the sailors of the USS John S. McCain in my prayers today.

Tonight's speech by President Trump showed a firm commitment to achieving a stable, peaceful Afghanistan and rooting out terror. I  also share his feeling that it needs to be a joint effort- this is a fight of global democracies against the forces of terrorism and there should be investment by other nations (including Afghanistan) not just the US carrying the burden. With American leadership and the support of allies, as well as Trump's approach of actually listening to the military leaders in the field when it comes to strategy, we can achieve a lasting peace.

In the face of incredible damage and danger, Texas is showing how Americans stick together to take care of our neighbors. The heroism and lifesaving efforts in Houston have been nothing short of inspiring. If you’re interested in learning more or helping the cause in Houston, you can find more information here:

My office continues to monitor the latest with regards to North Korea. I have nothing but the strongest condemnation for this latest nuclear test - dangerous, reckless, with zero regard for global peace and order. With each new test Kim Jong Un is committing his nation to a path that leads in a terrible direction. We must continue to work towards a peaceful solution to de-nuclearize North Korea, but let our message be clear: America stands with her Asian allies and will not hesitate to protect them, or any of our territories.

There wouldn’t be a DACA debate if our country didn’t have a serious problem with illegal immigration. While President Obama’s solution was to create policy without Congress, offering amnesty without real action to address the root cause, President Trump is making the correct decision to allow Congress to legislate and return to constitutional order.   The real issue at hand is there are millions of individuals in the United States illegally. Congress needs to address the cause, not just the symptom, and curb illegal immigration. The DACA debate is an important reminder that increasing border security and enforcing immigration laws have to be top priorities for the 115th Congress.
Join us live as we remember and honor the passengers of Flight 93 at the hallowed ground in Shanksville, Pennsylvania:

I keep this flag in my office as a solemn reminder of all our nation's loved ones taken from us on September 11, 2001. I pass it every morning when I walk in. Sixteen years ago today, extremists declared war on our very way of life and Americans responded with heroism, bravery, and patriotism. There's no better example than in Shanksville, where the passengers of Flight 93 had just two words for the terror our country was facing:  "Let's roll."

With today’s budget agreement, Congress is on track to deliver meaningful reform to a broken tax code that works against middle-class families and small businesses. We are now one step closer to creating a fair, simple tax system that will jump-start the American economy and allow Pennsylvanians to keep more of their paychecks.

My Washington, D.C. office is now accepting applicants for Spring semester internships. Preference will be given to hard working students in the 9th Congressional District. You can find out more at https://shuster.house.gov/internships/

President Trump and I are committed to delivering lower and simpler taxes for hardworking Pennsylvanians. After initial review, I believe the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act is a good starting point for pro-growth tax reform and simplifying the United States’ complicated tax code. My staff and I are currently reviewing the bill in its entirety and will monitor the many inevitable amendments and changes to it as they happen.

In September, I joined a bipartisan letter with Pennsylvania representatives urging Speaker Ryan and Leader Pelosi to reauthorize the Children's Health Insurance Program.  Today I am happy to say the House of Representatives passed the Championing Healthy Kids Act of 2017 which reauthorizes CHIP for 5 years and extends other vital, popular health programs as well that millions of children rely on.

The House is voting soon on the #FY18NDAA -- a strong, bipartisan bill to restore our national defense and give our troops their largest pay raise in eight years.

The defense bill and troop pay raise has passed the House! I am glad it includes my standalone legislation, the Patriot Inventory Protection Act, which will benefit Letterkenny Army Depot in Franklin County and prevent a potential missile defense shortfall within the Army.

Today the House passed historic tax cuts and simplification--so hard working Pennsylvanians can keep more of their paychecks and and have a tax code that works FOR them, not against them.   With the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act the average family of 4 making the median income ($59,000) will save $1,182 in tax relief. The Chamber of Commerce estimates that the TCJA will raise the after-tax incomes for a middle class family in PA by $2,683.

Today is National Miner's Day, where we recognize the hard work and sacrifice by our nation's miners and thank them for their importance in our society. Miners have a much larger impact on our lives than many people realize and make most of modern life possible. Thank you, miners!

JUST IN: The House of Representatives has passed national concealed carry reciprocity, which ensures law-abiding citizens who protect themselves do not have to forfeit their 2nd amendment rights across state lines.

Law abiding citizens protecting themselves should not have to forfeit their constitutional rights at state lines. This is commonsense legislation that strengthens and protects second amendment rights and is long overdue.
